result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas Peter Weber

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: 4:11 PM Defendant Thomas Peter Weber not in court.  Attorney Elizabeth Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Court reviews case history and determines Def. is no longer in custody and should have been in court. State notes bond previously posted and requests warrant in the amount of $5,000.00 or body Nationwide. Court authorizes warrant in the amount of $5,000.00 or body Nationwide.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Thomas Peter Weber
Current: 106 N Mentonga, Crandon, WI 54520 United States  (Effective: 08-17-2022)
Prior: 8613 W Mitchell St, Milwaukee, WI 53214

Maintain Absolute Sobriety. 
No possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
No driving a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license. 
Defendant to apply with Public Defender within 7 days at 715-536-9105.
Def. must reside with parents at residence.

1:02 PM Defendant Thomas Peter Weber appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kelly L Hays in court for State of Wisconsin. All parties via zoom.  Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 4 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. Defendant to apply with Public Defender within 7 days.  State gives bail/bond recommendation with conditions. CC questions def prior record.  Def. makes statement and gives address. Def. just spoke with probation office. Court gives factors for setting bond & orders $1750 cash bond with conditions Maintain Absolute Sobriety. No possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, No driving a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license, No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license, & Defendant to apply with Public Defender within 7 days at 715-536-9105. Def. must reside with parents at residence.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
